channel.title: Help with one error please. **Not Fixed**
channel.description:
After reading the tut "Allow people to connect via your client" When i got to the server sided bit, i get this one error;
[code]client.java:2725: cannot find symbol symbol : variable LoggedOut location: class client LoggedOut = false; ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

item.title: Help with one error please. **Not Fixed**
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:2, topic:291227”]Yeah go to the Class Client file and Search LoggedOut = false; and try change the capital L to a small l

If that dont work then Recompile

Or you can Recompile from the Start, you’re Choice[/quote]

Surly that wouldn’t work, i thought about it but it just seemed to simple, ill give it a go lol

Yep, didn’t work;

client.java:2725: cannot find symbol symbol : variable loggedOut location: class client loggedOut = false; ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .

Maybe the UID int isn’t correct?Or in the wrong position?

int UID = inStream.readDWord();

Read full topic
item.source: Help with one error please. **Not Fixed**

item.title: Help with one error please. **Not Fixed**

item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Yeah go to the Class Client file and Search LoggedOut = false; and try change the capital L to a small l

If that dont work then Recompile

Or you can Recompile from the Start, you’re Choice
